avalancheActivity.comment: Places with blowing snow are particularly dangerous, as even a small load can trigger a small to medium-sized avalanche. Places where fresh snow has fallen on hard and icy ground are particularly dangerous.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind and snowfall increase the danger of avalanches.

snowpackStructure.comment: It started snowing today, with about 10 cm of light snow falling, carried by a strong northeasterly wind in exposed areas. New fallen snow has fallen on hard and icy ground and is therefore quite unstable. Particularly in places with blown snow, there is a greater danger of triggering an avalanche of packed snow.

tendency.highlights: Snow will continue overnight, with 5 to 10 cm of light and fluffy snow expected, least in the western Julian Mountains and the western Karavanke Mountains. Wind will carry snow in exposed positions.

weatherForecast.comment: Wednesday will be cloudy at first. Clouds will break up later in the day, but there will be no major clearings yet. Some peaks will be occasionally cloudy. A strong northeasterly wind will weaken during the day. It will be cold. Temperatures at 1500 m will be around -10 °C, at 2500 m around -15 °C.

avalancheActivity.comment: The new light snow has not adhered well to the old snow base. In moderate to strong north-easterly winds, slush is forming. Above the forest line in the Snežnik area, a snow avalanche can be triggered even at low loads. Spontaneous avalanches are also possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: More amount of new snow with wind.

snowpackStructure.comment: When it snows, the snowpack increases rapidly. Between 30 and 40 cm of light, dry snow fell on hard ground above about 1300 m. At the same time, moderate to strong winds are blowing, carrying the snow and building drifts and drifts. The snowpack is markedly uneven. There is a lot of blowing snow, especially on the leeward slopes.

tendency.highlights: Snow will weaken overnight and taper off during the day on Wednesday. An additional 10 to 20 cm of light snow may fall. Moderate to strong north-easterly winds will continue to blow, carrying snow and building drifts and drifts. Places with blowing snow will be dangerous.

weatherForecast.comment: Wednesday will be cloudy and occasionally foggy. Snow will taper off overnight, with light snow showers continuing during the day. Visibility will improve only slightly. A moderate to strong northeasterly wind will blow, carrying snow. Winds will start to weaken in the afternoon. It will be cold. Temperatures will be around -8 °C at 1000 m and -12 °C at 1500 m.

avalancheActivity.comment: The new light snow has not adhered well to the old snow base. In moderate to strong north-easterly winds, slush is forming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: More amount of new snow with wind.

snowpackStructure.comment: When it snows, the snowpack slowly increases. Between 20 and 40 cm of light, dry snow has fallen. At the same time, a moderate wind is blowing, which carries the snow and builds drifts and drifts. The snowpack is highly uneven. There is a lot of blowing snow, especially on the leeward slopes.

tendency.highlights: There will be light to moderate snow at times. Snow will weaken overnight on Wednesday and taper off by Wednesday evening. A further 10 to 20 cm of light snow may fall.

weatherForecast.comment: Wednesday will continue with cloudy weather, with occasional fog on the higher peaks. Snow will weaken overnight Wednesday. During the day, light snow will continue to fall occasionally. There will be moderate north-easterly winds. It will be cold. The temperature at 1000 m will be around -9 °C.
